newsitem.title: UK: Avocet upbeat despite loss in year.
newsitem.headline: Avocet upbeat despite loss in year.

text.p: Avocet Mining Plc, the international mining group and largest tungsten producer in the western world, said on Thursday that it expects profits from gold to offset declining losses in tungsten in the first half of the current year.
The group announced its loss before tax widened to 2.7 million stg in the year to March 31, 1997 from 2.1 million previously. Turnover rose to 26.0 million stg from 19.4 million last time.
However, the group recorded pretax profit of 300,000 stg in the second half as a result of the opening of the Penjom gold mine in Malaysia.

"We are trading profitably and in the second half of the year we would anticipate an increase in gold production and profitability together with a tighter market a better price for tungsten," said chief executive Jocelyn Waller.
Avocet said the second half gold business will benefit from the treatment of the higher grade ores from the northern pit at the Penjom gold mine.

"For the first half of the current year, we expect a continuation of the current situation, with profits from gold offsetting declining losses in the tungsten business," said chairman Nigel McNair Scott.
